My first game ever was CS:CZ which one of my cousins got for me, a cracked client. I spent countless hours in the game, since back then I did not have friends, or an internet connection to play with online, so I played the single player missions for hours on end. Nostalgia hit hard when I purchased a copy for myself and started playing it.

Now most people who play Counter-Strike grew up with 1.6. I grew up with Condition Zero. I had both games on our house PC but I spent 95% of my time on CZ. Why? Because it had bots, and fantastic ones at that. We didn't have internet at the time so most my time was spent killing bots over and over on different maps. We got internet access down the line but, considering the time, it was very slow. So I used to browse FPSBanana (now GameBanana) for hours looking for maps and skins to download and then waiting an excruciating amount of time for them to finish. I would then install them and it's almost playing a new game! When people ask me what my childhood was in term of games, very few games spring to mind. Need for Speed 2, Virtua Cop 2 and Condition Zero.

Now obviously, people say this is just a reskin of Counter-Strike 1.6 with bots, which it is. But the fact that it is, makes it so much better for me. Who wouldn't want Counter-Strike 1.6 with better skins, models and textures? AND bot support?

Should you play it now? Well if you're looking for quintessential old online Counter-Strike experience, you should go with Counter-Strike 1.6, as its community is still thriving and is more active than CZ. If you want the most active Counter-Strike scene, CSGO is your place to go. If you're looking for the best single-player experience with community mods, maps and skins, or if you're stuck at home with no internet, which I wonder how you're reading this in the first place, Source is your game, since CSGO has limited moddability. But it doesn't mean you shouldn't give this a try, even if you're just buying this to complete your Counter-Strike collection, in which case you would already have this in your library. Condition Zero is essentially single-player CS1.6, and if that interests you then by all means!

Even though it's old, for me it's the first experience that was great, as you see 7h of nonstop playing is saying something, learning all the key binds and such, isn't hard at all, bought with cs bundle.

Basically, recommended.

el juego es una poronga de una
1. es lo mismo que el 1.6 pero con otras texturas y con cosas arregladas.
2. tiene un modo historia que literalmente es jugar con bots en los mapas clasicos(de_dust2-de-nuke etc) y vos controlas a distintos personajes con habilidades diferentes, ademas no podes ser tt, siempre sos ct -_-
3.Tiene la version de escenas eliminadas que viene cuando te compras este juego y el 1.6, pero no lo jugue.
4.casi nadie lo jugo(no literalmente), vi un video de todos los conters y la gran mayoria ni lo conocia a este juego xd
5. el online es lo mismo, pero mas choto y ademas los servers creo que estan vacios jajaja

En fin, no te lo recomiendo, preferible comprarse el cs 1.6 ya que es mejor y no es una PORONGA (?
1.6 but better it has also a campaign and public servers.

Probably the most underrated counter strike game of the whole series and also the only counter strike game with a great single player campaign with challenging bots that will definitely test your skills and quick reactions , it's definitely still worth purchasing because of the campaign itself and also the great multiplayer and online mode which is always active , definitely go for it if you love FPS games , you will never get bored of it as it will never be quite easy even if you are a typical freak in FPS games.
Community servers are kinda dead. I mostly just play this with my gf on a LAN game with bots. Lots of fun regardless.
